name: Sweet Corn
climate: Sweet corn thrives in warm climates with temperatures between 60-95Â°F.
It prefers growing in areas where the frost-free season is long.
Adequate rainfall or irrigation is needed for optimal growth.
Corn is sensitive to cool temperatures, hindering germination.
sunlight: Sweet corn requires full sunlight to grow and produce well.
At least 6 to 8 hours of direct sunlight is necessary daily.
Lack of sunlight can result in poor kernel development.
Ensure the plants are not shaded by other taller crops.
watering: Corn requires consistent moisture, especially in dry spells.
Ensure deep watering to allow roots to access sufficient water.
Water stress can lead to poor pollination and smaller ears.
Maintain a balance to avoid waterlogging and root diseases.
soil: Corn grows best in well-drained, loamy soil with rich organic matter.
The ideal soil pH for sweet corn is between 6.0 and 6.8.
Compacted soil impedes root growth and affects stability.
Use of mulch can improve water retention and soil quality.
extra_care_tip: Sweet corn benefits from fertilization at planting and mid-season.
Regular weeding is necessary to reduce competition for nutrients.
